description: Demolition of single storey rear extension and outbuildings; construction of two storey rear extension and single storey attached plant and refuse store; construction of a single storey outbuilding for use as a garage within the curtilage; internal works to create partition walls and openings, and refurbishment; reinstatement of external openings and alterations to fenestration; refurbishment of exterior surfaces; and installation of conservation roof lights to restore habitable use of the building as a single dwelling house (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: Time Limit
The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of two years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun. The development is permitted as enabling development to support the restoration and conversion of a grade II listed building, a heritage asset. The heritage asset, whilst presently capable of beneficial conversion, is in a declining state of repair and the Local Planning Authority considers it appropriate to reduce the time period for the implementation of the permission and the associated listed building consent to secure the objective of the restoration of the listed building at the earliest opportunity and, if the permission(s) are not implemented, to provide an opportunity to review the permission to ensure that the case for the enabling development remains valid.
| Approved Drawings

The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 4001 Rev A (Location Plan as Proposed); 2000 Rev C (Site Plan as Proposed); 2010 Rev E (Ground Floor Plan as Proposed); 2011 Rev D (First Floor Plan as Proposed); 2012 Rev D (Roof Plan as Proposed); 2201 Rev D (North and South Elevations as Proposed); 2202 Rev D (East and West Elevations as Proposed); 2020 (New Garage as Proposed); 5000 (Site Plan Demolition); 5010 (Ground Floor Plan Demolition); 5011 First Floor Plan Demolition; 5012 (Roof Plan Demolition); 5201 (North and South Elevations Demolition) 5202 (East and West Elevations Demolition)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Recording of Demolished Elements

Prior to first occupation of the development, a Historic England Level 3 Recording of the demolished elements shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and a hard copy shall be deposited with the local archive.

Reason In order to retain accurate public records of the listed buildings concerned, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 7.8 and 7.9 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(h), 1.2(g) and 2.1 (c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy DPD (2012); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Details of Exterior Treatments, Finishes and Sash Windows
Prior to the commencement of the development hereby permitted full details including technical specifications and samples of materials, treatments and finishes to be used for:
o	The exterior render;
o	Roofing including parapet walls;
o	Windows and doors; and
o	Flooring and damp proofing;

shall be submitted for approval by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with Historic England. This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in the application. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials are appropriate to preserve the special architectural and historic interest of the listed building in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 7.8 and 7.9 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(h), 1.2(g) and 2.1 (c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy DPD (2012); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Protection of Chimney Stacks

Notwithstanding any indication to the contrary on any plans or documents, prior to commencement of any works to the chimney stacks, a proposed works schedule and method statement, supported by a structural report shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval, assessing the following:
o	The retention of the existing chimneys in-situ;
o	The extent of repair and restoration of the chimney stacks using  salvageable materials;
o	The extent of new matching materials to be proposed in any rebuilding
The approved works shall only be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).
